Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: ChanelCinq
Reviews.Content: They charged us 130 USD and gave us a choice of 2 different rooms. We choose one over looking the pool that had a rancid musty odor. The smell was afoul but after 30 minutes or so in the room you tend to notice it less. They must have a light bulb issue. At night walking to the room all the lights on the path were out. Then we got to our room and the reading lamp was missing a bulb. We went down to the desk and asked for one and they said they would bring it up. After 30 minutes we fun another hallway and removed a bulb and they never did end up bringing the bulb. I am not a picky traveler but this place is maybe worth 50 USD a night and NOT 130. We should have stayed at Gladys Guest house for under 50. Oh and I read the reviews about the restaurant. Well I guess it was so bad it went out of business because there is no restaurant on the premises however their sign out front still boasts they have a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “go some place else”
Reviews.Author: Roly_movie
Reviews.Content: The hotel has excelent location, but poor administration don't eat in the restaurant "la pared" service is terrible... go eat at "sangria coÃ±o" place is more native (macheteros) better to go Ponce holiday inn or villa parguera hotel. Roly

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: ChaseSF
Reviews.Content: What a horrible experience. We arrived and thought it would be okay, since the outside and back patio of the parador looked decent. First of all, the girl working at the front said it was her first day at the desk. She said that she normally worked in their restaurant (which, by the way, does not open during the weekdays; only only sat & sun; but you will notice that this is not what is advertised on the sign out front: see pic). She gave us a room that was supposed to be one of their high end rooms. It was horrible!!! There were tears in the rug, and it was the size of a small dorm room. Not to mention, the ugly decor. We went right back down and complained and they gave us another room (not ocean front as we paid for), facing the street. The room was a 2 on a scale of 1-10. The room itself "appeared" clean. The toilet was filthy, and the coach had a few stains. Because it was too late to find another hotel and it didn't seem like there would have been anything better, since La Pagueria is such a small town, we decided to stay. Never again will we stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: nathayes
Reviews.Content: The place is very run down and is in serious need of a major renovation. DO NOT eat at their restaurant. The food is awful. We were the only ones there, and we were there for a good 1 1/2 hours. No wonder. You can get better mufongo at a takeout restaurant, and for considerably less money. As the other dishes came out, it was one disappointment after another. Even the bread was bad. Wow. On several occasions, when we needed something, no one was at the front desk. If you want an enjoyable experience in PR, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , but highly needed quality service”
Reviews.Author: Makeitrain
Reviews.Content: Were do I start .... 1st they are lacking of employees ,they have the same guy to check you in, attend the bar ,serve an cook breakfast , room service ( Joel your the man ).With 1 employee doing all this how can you expect any type of good service. 2nd the pool needs to be cleaned and painted ,because there was scum all over the place. I love my island of Puerto Rico ,but Porlamar is in need of more employees and people that really care. The girl from front desk did not know anything ,she was just their. Really the best thing that I liked was the location and air conditioner ,beside this what else can I say .I usually say positive comments ,but you are lacking of service. Sorry Porlamar I will never return to your facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Parador Posada Porlamar”
Reviews.Author: ElGringoViajero
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Parador Posada Porlamar three times as part of a dive package in conjunction with Parguera Divers, the dive shop on the grounds of the inn. The rooms come with TV, a private bath (shower only, no tub) and are air conditioned. The rooms are simple. You won't find fluffy towels or chocolates on the pillow, just a simple, clean, room and bath. I have only stayed in the top two floors. There are two lower floors as well. After I made my reservation with the dive shop for this third trip, I received a call notifying me that there would be live music on the weekends and was given the opportunity to cancel. I decided to keep my room and am glad I did since the music was not loud. The inn is near several restaurants and bars and two small markets as well . A pharmacy is nearby for your convenience. I only ate in the hotel restaurant once because I received a meal voucher for $25. The food was quite good, but I felt it was a little pricey. This is a great "bang for the buck" as long as you are not looking for luxury. The dive shop itself is outstanding. Angel Rovira runs a first class operation. My experience each time has been very positive because I had a certain set of expectations and am pleased with how things turned out.

Reviews.Title: “Great dives, great food”
Reviews.Author: soaringfalcon
Reviews.Content: When I arrived in San Juan and rented a car to make the long trip to La Parguera the rental agent's eyes lit up. He explained that Americans don't normally go there, it is more of a local vacation spot. I hoped that the diving would be all that I imagined. It was. The owner of the dive shop on the premise of Posada Polamar, Angel, is extremely knowledgeable and very safety minded. I dove six days with him and his crew (Victor is also an awesome dive master) I was constantly amazed at Angel's knowledge and ability to draw a good laugh. While diving I saw two barracuda's and one shark as well as the assortment of eels, tropical fish and one of the most beautiful walls. One mistake I made is booking the cheapest room (this was quickly upgraded by the hotel after I complained). The first floor rooms really are not good rooms. Do yourself a favor and make sure your room is not on the first floor (1XX). The food in the hotel was the best I could find in La Parguera. Make sure you give the Paella a try!! (hint: don't eat at the Steak restaurant across the street from the hotel...trust me on this one) Great dives, great food. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Did the Diving package at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: whittel
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through pagueras divers which has a shop and its dive boat at the hotel. For anyone who scuba dives this is excellent diving and a great set up. The hotel is clean and nice. If the lowest class hotel you are willing to stay at is a Hilton then don't bother. The rooms are not fancy but the A/C works and we stayed on the top floor which had great views. It is nice to roll out of bed and walk down to the dive boat to do your diving. The hotel serves breakfast which is included and give one dinner which was included. breakfast wasn't fancy (either fresh eggs, frozen eggo waffles, or frozen eggo pancakes) but the dinner is very fancy and expensive. Actually they gave a $50 voucher for the dinner and you'll spend over that. If you are diving, definitely stay there. If you are just visting the area, it is clearly one of the nicer hotels in that area (closest hilton is Ponce)

Reviews.Title: “Enchantment at Posada Porlamar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our lovely stay at Posada Porlamar.....where to start..we got a wonderfull room with an incredible view of the Caribeann Sea...we dinned at the hotel restaurant La Pared.... we had a great dinner, ostrich!!! in a white wine reduction...There are no words to describe it....Last but not least, the employees at Posada Porlamar made us feel like family ...We are definitely going back next summer...Two thumps way up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Porlamar Por Favor!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing I have to say about this parador is that at least we could find a place to sleep a few hours after being in Boqueron and Mayaguez all day. The problem was that the room was incredibly dirty. Examples of the lack of cleanliness include body hairs in the bedroom sheets, bathtub, and a nice spider that came down on top of us while we were somehow trying to fall asleep. Next time, I will keep driving even if I fall asleep on the road rather than stay here. As a Puerto Rican that was trying to show his wife how beautiful his home country is, I was totally embarrased by the condition of the hotel. Too bad, because the location is great, right in front of La Parguera.

Reviews.Title: “Porlamar Problem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room was a windowless white box with a single circular flourescent light. The upstairs rooms are probably better. The hotel restaurant, La Pared, is unbelievably expensive. Our $25 each dinner voucher didn't cover half the bill and we are not extravagent. The food is mediocre. A big plus is that the scuba operation on site, Parguera Divers, is excellent.

HotelInfo.Name: Parador Posada Porlamar
HotelInfo.Address: Carr 304 Km 3.3 | Lajas, 00667, Puerto Rico
